title: Manchester United's injury crisis continues with Paul Pogba not ready to face Newcastle
text:
Paul Pogba is unlikely to play in Manchester United’s clash at Newcastle with manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer expecting all of his injured stars to miss the trip to St James’ Park on Sunday.

That means United could be without Pogba, Anthony Martial, Luke Shaw and Aaron Wan-Bissaka, while Jesse Lingard limped out of Thursday’s Europa League draw with AZ Alkmaar in Holland with a hamstring strain.

Pogba was left at home for that game after suffering a recurrence of the ankle injury that has forced the Frenchman to miss four of the last six matches.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer doesn't expect any of his injured players to be fit to face Newcastle

Paul Pogba is unlikely to play for Manchester United against Newcastle due to an ankle injury

MANCHESTER UNITED'S ABSENTEES Paul Pogba - Ankle Anthony Martial - Hamstring Jesse Lingard - Hamstring Aaron Wan-Bissaka - Illness Eric Bailly - Knee Phil Jones Timothy Fosu-Mensah - Knee Luke Shaw - Hamstring

Martial and Shaw have been sidelined recently with hamstring problems while Wan-Bissaka is recovering from the illness that has kept him out of England duty.

Solskjaer admitted that he doesn’t expect to see any of the players back in action until after the international break, and hopes there will be no more absentees following United’s goalless draw on a plastic pitch in The Hague on Thursday night.

‘I don’t know,’ he said. ‘Let’s see on Saturday morning. Probably not. There are a few backs hurting now.

'It’s a hard surface, very hard, but hopefully they’ll be okay. They will have a couple of days for recovery and should be ready for Newcastle – no excuses whatsoever.’

On Pogba, he added: ‘Probably not. There’s an international break as well, and it might be time for us to give him 10 or 14 days extra to be ready for Liverpool.’
